content.description: Start Free Willy, but continue up through thin holds to a less victorious final crux. This less contrived, more direct variation of Free Willy utilizes the thin left hand crimp you normally dyno from as a right hand instead. It is an excellent problem in it's own right, and for those who can't pull the dyno of FW, a good consolation prize.
content.location: If looking at bloody flapper drop through a crawl space to the right by where the gloria boulder meets the start of lip sync. You can also come at it from the north side by the dam buster problem.

content.description: Start on two jugs to a left crimp. Climb up and exit on jugs.
content.location: Far left side of Lost Kitten Boulder (left of Free Willy).

content.description: Fun climbing on incut jugs. The start is the crux, start on the very right side of the boulder and follow the jugs left working upwards to a good lip. Once you hit the dish, mantle the lip and climb straight up to top out.

This problem bakes in the sun for most of the day making it a good stop at the end of the day or on a cloudy day.  Start on good holds at the left side of the face.  Move through two pockets and hit a thin slot up and right.  From here make a shoulder move to a big hold for the left hand, one more move leads to good holds for the top out.
content.location: This problem is adjacent to the Lost Cause Boulder.  Problem is opposite the start of Lip Sync and Banana Juice.

content.description:
Note: My understanding is that the holds to the left (on the Pussy Route) are off limits for Free Willy.  

  Start with a good right hand in the low pockets and a left sloping crimp. You can start with a right heel hook by your right hand and a left back step (traditional beta), or just toe down on some bad feet. Go left hand to the sloper, right hand to the tooth and continue up and eventually right on pretty decent crimps. The finish can be done one of two ways: go left hand to the bad crimp, hike a high right foot and dyno to the lip with your right hand, or you can use the bad 1/4" sloping crimp with your right as an intermediate before going to the lip. Not really sure which one is easier, but I felt the intermediate was more consistent.
content.protection: A few pads and a spotter.
content.location: If looking at bloody flapper drop through a crawl space to the right by where the gloria boulder meets the start of lip sync. You can also come at it from the north side by the dam buster problem.

content.description: Hard climbing on jugs, sketchy top out so tread lightly.
content.location: Crawl through a hole between the Lost Cause Boulder and the boulder with the graffiti "Gloria" on it. It is the furthest right climb on the Lost Cause boulder, beyond the hole and opposite the boulder with Free Willy.

content.description: Start with either hand on the tooth-like incut crimp at 8 ft (the bloody flapper hold).  Make a few hard moves to get the jug and finish easily.  With the right beta this problem will feel fairly easy, without the right beta it may feel hard.  The finish while high is easy just watch out for loose rock.  Don't let the name scare you while the starting hold is sharp none of the other holds are too bad.
content.protection: Pad, maybe two pads to reach the starting holds.
content.location: In the middle of the Lost Descent Boulder.  First problem right of the "Tub" area that Dean's Journey starts out of.

content.description:
The crux is releasing the left hand from the sloper to lean out to the good sloping rail, matching it, and holding the swing.   

  One of the most unique boulder problems in Hueco Tanks if not the world, Dean's Journey is a unique experience full of fun thuggy moves bizarre mantles and improbable holds.
content.location: This problem begins on the lowest left holds of the boulder on two jugs.  The problem traverses into a traverse and gets situated in the unique feature (I don't even know what to call it) and then finishes by traversing right and manteling out by the holds of Bloody Flapper.

content.description: Start on good holds on the far right of the Lost Cause boulder. Traverse left into Bloody Flapper, staying low where Lip Sync climbs up and left. Finish on Bloody Flapper.
content.location: From the Pond Parking, immediately take the right fork of the trail. Stay left at the next fork and ascend the first set of chains. Rather than turning right and hiking up the hill to approach the second set of chains, stay low and continue straight until you see the Lost Boulders in a group on your right. At this point the Lost Cause boulder (a house-sized boulder) is on your left.

content.description: Great area with climbs for everyone on this boulder or near it.
